attributes.description: Cabin pressure range maintained by the system ensuring optimal comfort and structural integrity.
attributes.name: pressureRange

attributes.description: Maximum allowable delay for the pressurization system to adjust pressure levels.
attributes.name: responseTime

attributes.description: Redundancy configuration for pressure measurement ensuring backup sensor data availability.
attributes.name: redundancyLevel

attributes.description: Operational altitude range within which the pressurization system maintains effective performance.
attributes.name: operationalAltitude

attributes.description: Scheduled maintenance interval to ensure system reliability and longevity.
attributes.name: maintenanceInterval

designScenario.description: The Pressurization System is a critical subsystem in modern aircraft designed to maintain a safe and comfortable cabin pressure environment throughout all phases of flight. By dynamically regulating the differential pressure, the system simulates a sea-level environment regardless of external altitude and weather conditions. It integrates advanced sensors, automated valve control, and redundant safety mechanisms to promptly adjust pressure deviations and prevent potential structural or passenger safety risks.
designScenario.name: Pressurization System

details.description: The system shall continuously monitor cabin pressure and adjust valve positions to maintain pressure between 0.8 atm and 1.2 atm.
System response to pressure deviations must be executed within 3 seconds to prevent discomfort and structural imbalances.
The pressurization system shall employ redundant pressure sensors and include an emergency overpressure relief mechanism to mitigate potential cabin over-pressurization.
The system design must facilitate ease of maintenance and modular upgrades, ensuring minimal downtime and alignment with aviation engineering standards.

relationships.description: The Control Unit processes sensor inputs from the Pressure Regulation Unit to dynamically adjust cabin pressure.
The Pressure Regulation Unit depends on the Control Unit for issuing commands to its valve control mechanisms.
The Emergency Safety Module is composed of the Overpressure Relief Valve, ensuring rapid pressure mitigation during emergency conditions.
The Pressure Regulation Unit aggregates the Emergency Safety Module to seamlessly integrate safety functions within the pressurization system.

systemComponents.description: Central processing component for the pressurization system that monitors sensor inputs and issues control commands.
systemComponents.name: Control Unit

subComponents.description: User interface module providing real-time pressure data and system status for flight crew.
subComponents.name: User Interface Module

subComponents.description: Data processing module that runs pressure control algorithms and diagnostic routines.
subComponents.name: Data Processing Module

systemComponents.description: Subsystem responsible for managing the regulation of cabin pressure through sensors and valves.
systemComponents.name: Pressure Regulation Unit

subComponents.description: Pressure regulator actuator that adjusts the airflow to maintain desired cabin pressure.
subComponents.name: Pressure Regulator

subComponents.description: Sensor measuring external inlet air pressure to assist in regulation.
subComponents.name: Inlet Pressure Sensor

subComponents.description: Sensor monitoring the cabin pressure in real-time.
subComponents.name: Cabin Pressure Sensor

subComponents.description: Valve control assembly managing the opening and closing of pressure control valves.
subComponents.name: Valve Control Assembly

systemComponents.description: Safety module that provides emergency pressure relief in case of system failure or over-pressurization.
systemComponents.name: Emergency Safety Module

subComponents.description: Overpressure relief valve designed to activate automatically during pressure anomalies.
subComponents.name: Overpressure Relief Valve

systemComponents.description: An integrated suite of pressure sensors dedicated to accurate and redundant pressure measurement.
systemComponents.name: Pressure Sensor Module

subComponents.description: Primary pressure sensor ensuring continuous monitoring of cabin pressure.
subComponents.name: Primary Pressure Sensor

subComponents.description: Secondary (redundant) pressure sensor providing backup measurements.
subComponents.name: Secondary Pressure Sensor

constraintBlocks.expression: OperatingPressureRange >= 300 psi and OperatingPressureRange <= 500 psi and ResponseTime <= 5 sec and SensorAccuracy <= 2% and OperatingTemperatureRange between -20°C and 50°C
constraintBlocks.name: PressurizationParametricConstraints

requirements.name: Pressurization System Requirement
requirements.text: The system shall operate within the specified operating pressure range, response time, sensor accuracy, and operating temperature range.

rag_context: Pressurization System的所有信息和规格说明包括操作压力范围、响应时间、传感器精度和操作温度范围。
